param.name: in_raster
param.datatype: Raster Dataset or Raster Catalog or Raster Data Layer
param.dialogReference: Input raster for horizon angle calculation, must be a cardinal oriented raster, meaning the rightmost column correspond to the east and the leftmost column is the closest to the west. Datatypes allowed are DERasterDataset, DERasterCatalog and GPRasterDataLayer.

param.name: direction_angle
param.dialogReference: Input direction angle in polar coordinates, East = 0 finds the highest angular obstruction looking to the right for each row in the raster, North = 90 finds the highest angular obstruction looking up, West = 180, South = 270.

param.name: current_ws
param.displayname: Save output to the current ArcGIS workspace
param.dialogReference: Be sure that the raster spatial reference match the one of the project workspace, the raster will be created, but could not display properly.

param.name: f_e
param.displayname: Apply a function to the output

param.name: s_e
param.displayname: Apply an operation to the output
